intro: Dimorphotheca polyptera, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow or orange flower heads, which are surrounded by white or pale pink ray florets. It typically grows in open grasslands and is often found in coastal areas. Dimorphotheca polyptera is well adapted to arid conditions and is commonly used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
